page.title: 12Bradstone Manor Farm Wood
page.content: This uningabited area is approached by a narrow road between Bradstone and Bawcombe Farms. The hill top falls away to the east and north and is bounded by a stream, the Winnie flowing into the Tamar. The land is used primarily for sheep with one arable field on the hill top. Bordered by farm track and strip of grassland lies an area of deciduous woodlan clinging to the steep hillside. Oak, ash, beech, sycamore, hornbeam, silver birch, with blackthorn and hawthorn bordering the stream. Difficulty of access makes this a natural habitat for wildlife including; deer fox, badger, and valley birds. In the wood's northern corner is evidence of a disused quarry where openings to extensive badger setts can be seen.
